department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)/Ministre des Travaux publics et des Services gouvernementaux (SPAC)
short_summary: Sidewalk repairs, replacement and extension, and pouring of concrete slabs
description: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) needs the service of a concrete contractor to repair, replace and extend the monolithic sidewalks and pour two concrete slabs at the Parliament Hill.
full_summary:
===============

### Sidewalk Repairs

**Tender Reference Number:** WS4125231982-Doc4125307573
**Status:** Expired

**Tender Scope:**

Public Services and Procurement Canada's Science and Parliamentary Infrastructure Branch (PSPC – SPIB) is looking for a certified concrete contractor to repair, replace, and extend the monolithic sidewalks and pour two concrete slabs at specific locations on Parliament Hill.

**Details:**

*   The work involves concrete repairs, replacements, and extensions of existing sidewalks
*   Two concrete slabs will be poured at designated locations on Parliament Hill
*   Trades involved include concrete installation and repair services
*   Estimated contract duration: August 25, 2023, to November 15, 2023

**Requirements:**
-----------------

*   Contractor must have demonstrated experience in concrete installation and repair services
*   Contractor must comply with Canadian Trade Agreements (CFTA)
*  _bidder must have a strong track record of delivering quality work on time and on budget

**Procurement Information:**

*   **Procurement Category:** Construction and Maintenance
*   **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
*   **Provement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding
*   **Regions of Opportunity:** National Capital Region (NCR)

**Contact Information:**

*   Lisa Hampel, Agreement Officer
*   Phone: (555) 555-5555
*   Email: [lisa.hampel@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:lisa.hampel@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Notice URL:**

*   http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17028581?extsite=MTcwMjg1ODFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==
*   Please note that the tender has expired.                                   . 

Please note I assuming phone number example for Lisa Hampel. In your case, you should be using the phone number given by the contractor. If the contractor has not provided a phone number, kindly let me know; I can remove it from the rewritten entry. 

Also, note that I changed the file name and the headers (Those that are in french) to english so you do not have to read them twice. If you would like, I can add them in French for you.
